On MacOS X I cannot have more than one Display and I'm running into a problem when 
shutting down Eclipse because a new Display is created in
ConsoleDocumentManager.launchRemoved after the original Display has been 
disposed. OK, not being able to have more than on Display is my problem :-)

However, I think it is at least questionable to create another Display (on some platforms 
not a lightweight operation) which isn't disposed of properly at the very end.

Darin, I see the refactored code, but the walkback shows that the extra Display object was getting created as a result of the DebugUIPlugin.getStandardDisplay() call, and this call is still present.  So I guess I don't see how the refactoring will prevent the problem.
Darin, I think I added you as a CC after I made my previous comment.  Am I missing something?

ConsoleDocumentManager no longer calls launchRemoved(..) which calls 
#getStandardDisplay. It now calls removeLaunch(...), which does not call 
#getStandardDisplay.
